TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebServiceBindingAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Declares a binding that defines one or more XML Web service methods. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A binding, as defined by Web Services Description Language (WSDL), is similar to an interface, in that it defines a concrete set of operations. Each XML Web service method is an operation within a particular binding. XML Web service methods are members of either the default binding for an XML Web service or a binding specified within a WebServiceBindingAttribute applied to a class implementing an XML Web service. An XML Web service can implement multiple bindings, by applying multiple WebServiceBindingAttribute attributes to an XML Web service.
Once one or more <xref:System.Web.Services.WebServiceAttribute> attributes are applied to an XML Web service, a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute> or <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapRpcMethodAttribute> can be applied to individual XML Web service methods to indicate the binding operation implemented by a particular XML Web service method. Set the <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute.Binding%2A> property of <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute> or <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapRpcMethodAttribute> to specify the binding an XML Web service method is implementing an operation for.
## Examples The following XML Web service implements operations from four bindings. Specifically, the XML Web service declares three bindings it implements operations for, by applying three WebServiceBindingAttribute attributes to the XML Web service.
To specify which binding an XML Web service method is implementing an operation for, a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute> is applied to each of the XML Web service methods, except `DefaultBindingMethod`. By not specifying a binding for `DefaultBindingMethod`, it is implementing an operation on the default binding for the XML Web service.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the binding an XML Web service method is implementing an operation for. Sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.WebServiceBindingAttribute.Name%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class setting the name of the binding the XML Web service method is implementing.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor is used to specify a name for a binding defined in the XML Web service it is applied to and is a member of the default namespace.
## Examples The following example specifies a binding named `LocalBinding` that is defined in the `BindingSample` XML Web service.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, string ns) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the binding an XML Web service method is implementing an operation for. Sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.WebServiceBindingAttribute.Name%2A> property.
The namespace associated with the binding. Sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.WebServiceBindingAttribute.Namespace%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor is used to specify a name for a binding defined in the XML Web service it is applied to that and is a member of the supplied namespace.
## Examples The following example specifies a binding named `LocalBindingNonDefaultNamespace` that is a member of the `http://www.contoso.com/MyBinding` namespace and defined in the `BindingSample` XML Web service.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]

MemberSignature.Value: public WebServiceBindingAttribute (string name, string ns, string location);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, string ns, string location) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the binding an XML Web service method is implementing an operation for. Sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.WebServiceBindingAttribute.Name%2A> property.
The namespace associated with the binding. Sets the <xref:System.Web.Services.WebServiceBindingAttribute.Namespace%2A> property.
The location where the binding is defined.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor is used to specify a name for a binding not defined in the XML Web service it is applied to that and is a member of the supplied namespace.
## Examples The following example specifies a binding named `RemoteBinding` that is a member of the `http://www.contoso.com/MyBinding` namespace and defined at `http://www.contoso.com/MyService.asmx?wsdl`.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Web Services Interoperability (WSI) specification to which the binding claims to conform.
Docs.value: One of the values, indicating a WSI specification.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WS-I organization publishes guidelines to ensure the interoperability of Web services across platforms. This property indicates the WSI specification to which the binding claims to conform.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.WebServiceBindingAttribute.EmitConformanceClaims%2A> property controls whether the conformance claims are provided when a WSDL description of the Web service is published.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the binding emits conformance claims.
Docs.value: if the binding emits conformance claims; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of this property controls whether the conformance claims expressed by the <xref:System.Web.Services.WebServiceBindingAttribute.ConformsTo%2A> property are provided when a WSDL description of the Web service is published.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the location where the binding is defined.
Docs.value: The location where the binding is defined. The default is the URL of the XML Web service to which the attribute is applied.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example specifies a binding named `RemoteBinding` that is a member of the `http://www.contoso.com/MyBinding` namespace and defined at `http://www.contoso.com/MyService.asmx?wsdl`.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the binding.
Docs.value: The name of the binding. The default is the name of the XML Web service with "Soap" appended.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example specifies a binding named `LocalBinding` that is defined in the `BindingSample` XML Web service.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the namespace associated with the binding.
Docs.value: The namespace for the binding. The default is http://tempuri.org/.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example specifies a binding named `LocalBindingNonDefaultNamespace` that is a member of the `http://www.contoso.com/MyBinding` namespace and defined in the `BindingSample` XML Web service.
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]
